result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:03 PM Defendant Maliyah C-Aira Skye Stevens appeared by video, in custody from Onieda County.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Maliyah C-Aira Skye Stevens.  Calling along with Cory Ericksons 22CF32 and22CF45, appears from ACJ with attorney Blake Gross, Final status for those two cases.  Atty Erdman, have not reached an agreement intending to proceed to trial with Mr. Erickson.  Attorney Gross, no agreement intend to proceed to trial.  State file a motion, forwarded to both attorneys, filed today.  Off record.  Back on record 3:09, Court has not seen motion from the State.  State is having document scanned in and sent to que, asking for adjournment of trial, seeking to postpone.   Motion given to Judge by Atty Van Hollen.  Atty Gross, received copy of motion this morning, did tell def about motion, no research, Def keep right to speedy trial.  Atty Erdman received copy of motion this morning, just read now.  Not ruling on motion today, attorneys have not had time to talk to clients today.   Off the record for scheduling.  Back on the record.  3:18.  
Nothing else for cases scheduled for trial.  22CF32 (Erickson case) 22CF35 (Stevens case)
